taskbody.context: Use this procedure to configure Docker Engine.

step.cmd: Create a new Docker Engine drop-in file.

substep.cmd: Create a directory for the drop-in file, if necessary.
Create a backup of the drop-in file, if it exists.

stepxmp.codeblock: cat <<EOF > /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/docker.conf [Service] TimeoutSec=300 EnvironmentFile=-/etc/sysconfig/docker ExecStart= ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd \$OPTIONS TasksMax=infinity EOF

step.cmd: Configure and start the Docker Engine service.

substep.cmd: Create a variable for the name of the Docker Engine thin pool.

stepxmp.p: Replace Thin-Pool-Device with the name of the thin pool device, identified in a previous step:

substep.cmd: Create variables for adding arguments to the Docker Engine environment file. The --exec-opt argument is a workaround for a Docker issue on RHEL/CentOS 7.x systems.

stepxmp.codeblock: myDriver="--storage-driver devicemapper" myLog="--log-level=error" myFix="--exec-opt native.cgroupdriver=cgroupfs" myMount="--storage-opt dm.mountopt=discard" myFlag="--storage-opt dm.thinpooldev=$myPool"

substep.cmd: Add the arguments to the Docker Engine environment file.

substep.stepresult: The startup may take up to a minute as Docker Engine updates the storage layout.

step.cmd: Compare the previous version of the Docker Engine environment file with the new version, and add any customizations for your deployment to the new version.
step.info: If you change this file, restart Docker Engine with systemctl restart docker.
